data.message: Maybe , but huge number of people see that chrome is better, I'm one of them

Added this recently. I'm monitoring to see if it makes a significant difference. I'm terrible at controlling my tabs. Sometimes I have 50+ open at once. I'm also someone who uses a lot of extensions. So I have found this useful: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/context/aalnjolghjkkogicompabhhbbkljnlka?hl=en It allows you to group extensions (e.g., standard, webdev, tools, etc) and activate incrementally in any combination. Works well when you're set up. Extensions not in use suck RAM and add to the footprint of Chrome

https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/onetab/chphlpgkkbolifaimnlloiipkdnihall?hl=en
Ok. I use this extension and love it to begin with. I got it to only work when on battery and I think it helps with my battery consumption.

Now, allow me to hijack this thread. I have seen do many popular tech sites talk about this extension at the same time (around 3 weeks ago).

From experience, this kind of timing is never random, and often is the result of agreements with the editors (paid or not).

Anyone close enough or found a podcast or whatever that they have the insider story of how this was arranged by the extension creator?
i'm using this extension for more than a month now and for someone who opens at least 200+ tabs at the same time like me, I have just three words to say about it. IT. IS. AWESOME.

Allow me to hijack this thread too 3:)..
Can I find any convenience reason for this ? .. when I open facebook tab about ((60%)) of my "I5-3230M quad core 2.6GHz " resources is being used :( !
I tried disabling all Extensions .. closing all other tabs .. but nothing better happens ... yet when I switch to any other tab .. it's ok .. no more than 1% is used then ...

One thing that really helps is to set plugins tho run only on click. This saves you from all the evil Flash in the pages you visit, until you want to watch singing and then you just click it to work. Makes a big difference.
to be more specific about my question ... if any one can guess the solution ! it happens with any "fb group" tab

You probably need that extension if you are the kind of person who have tens of useless poorly coded extensions and you open a lot of tabs ... If you keep things simple, use extensions efficiently, keep the opened tabs close to what you really need then you will never have problems with memory management in Chrome :)

Ahmad Alfy it's a weird CPU usage problem ! not a RAM one .. 
I hv tried the that extension already .. nothing new ..
and I will be very happy if u shared ur magnificently coded extensions with us ðŸ˜‚ !

Osama, I think Ahmad's comment wad not about your issue but the post itself.

Ahmed, easier said than done to some people. Not all usage patterns are the same. Different people optimize certain areas and leave other based on their own style/priorities

I check the memory/cpu usage per extension from Chrome's tasks manager. If an extension is using high resources, I just remove it.
If I really need that extension then I disable it till I need it.
Most of the time you don't need 75% of the extensions you are using ...
example -> that extension that tells you what are the technologies a particular website is built with on the address bar. You don't need to know that 90% of the time.
example -> Additional DevTools debuggin extensions for JavaScript frameworks like Ember, Backbone, Angular ... etc. You don't need it till you are debudding something.
Also, DevTools takes a lot of resources. Don't leave it open in a tab without using them. Close it and open it when you need it.
Chrome might be far from optimized when it comes to resources, you have to overcome it with some techniques. Of move to something else like Firefox like what Amr Eldib was saying :)
For me, Chrome DevTools are indispensable
Mohamed Meligy Posted my comment before reading yours :) Yup you are right, perhapse I didn't choose my words wisely. I elaborated more with the techniques I use.

Ahmad Alfy, the extension I referenced above does that for you in an easy interface. One more extension, mind you, but to me worth the speed of one or two clicks over several each time I need X, Y or Z
My concern isn't extensions , i open about 60 - 80 tabs at the same time and i don't close them all because i still need them so it keeps increasing. And for me that's an awesome neat solution !
